citation.article-title: Thermodesulforhabdus norvegicus gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel sulfate-reducing bacterium from oil field water.

p.s: Thermodesulforhabdus (Ther.mo.de.sul.fo.rhabdus. Gr. adj. thermos warm, hot; L. pref.de from; L.n. sulfur sulfur; Gr.fem.n. rhabdos rod; M.L. masc. n. Thermodesulforhabdus thermophilic rod-shaped
Rod-shaped cells 1 x 2.5 Î¼m, motile with single polar flagella.
Does not contain desulfoviridin, desulfofuscidin, desulforubidin, or P582.
Nutritionally versatile, oxidizing a number of organic acids.
Complete oxidation of substrate to CO2.
Sulfate and sulfite used as electron acceptor for growth.
The genus Thermodesulforhabdus belongs to the delta subdivision of the Proteobacteria.
